intro: Cousinia bazoftensis, commonly known as the Bazoft sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. Cousinia bazoftensis is often found in mountainous areas and is a hardy species that can withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
